tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: Spacetime: Gravity – The force that holds everything together
programme.desc: The force of gravity. Nothing and no one can escape from it. This mysterious power surrounds and permeates us. Gravitation determines our life on earth, holds the universe together and is the key to understanding the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Vesta Unveiled
programme.desc: With the Dawn missions exploration of the asteroid Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres, asteroids are a hot topic. See what these incredible missions have uncovered.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Galactic Visions: Alien Worlds
programme.desc: The diversity, complexity, and downright beauty of our own solar system is astounding. Could such beauty exist in other parts of the universe as well? Thanks to modern science, we now have the capability to see for ourselves.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Advances - NASA refines the techniques needed for rendezvous. Cassini at Saturn - In the Cassini probe's final years of activity, its handlers are asking it to do more complex and risky assignments.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Flight Status
programme.desc: The latest updates on the new space hardware about to launch us into the next generation of space flight some rockets and capsules are on time others not so fortunate.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Dark Side
programme.desc: Perhaps that American politician was right. There are indeed things we know we don’t know.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Commences - Did Gemini give the US a lead in the space race? Venus Express - The last days of ESA's Venus probe. EMU - NASA's Extravehicular Mobility Unit. Deep Space Communications - ESA's worldwide network of giant dishes.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rays
programme.desc: Cosmic rays can tell us much about the universe. They are not simply another form of light, but carriers of information about powerful and unseen processes at work thousands or even millions of light years away.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Emissaries
programme.desc: Our solar system is vast, from our own star the Sun to Earth is nearly 150 million kilometers or 1 Astronomical Unit.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Cosmic Collisions
programme.desc: Cosmic and x rays, these mysterious and highly powerful particles from deep space are being investigated to finally discover where they come from.

programme.title: The New Frontier: First Light
programme.desc: For an instrument first developed as recently as the 17th century, the telescope has travelled a long way.

programme.title: The New Frontier: PEERING INTO THE ABYSS
programme.desc: Imaging a black hole was a breakthrough in astronomy, now with the new satellite IXPE high energy telescope we will be looking at some of the most dramatic, and most violent objects in the universe: Colliding Black holes and Neutron Stars.

programme.title: Spacetime: Astrobiology - The search for life
programme.desc: Are we alone? A question we ask ourselves every time we gaze deep into the endlessness of space. And the dream of discovering the origins of mankind is as old as civilization itself. Are there other worlds that support life?

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Milky Way
programme.desc: This episode traces our view of the Milky Way, from the mythology of ancient sky watchers to the efforts of scientists to map it from the inside out.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Planet X
programme.desc: The New Horizons mission continues deeper into space, it’s next target looming close.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Fountain of Creation
programme.desc: Without the Sun's warmth and light, life as we know it would not exist. It is the powerhouse of our planet and provides the energy we need to survive.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Proving Einstein
programme.desc: Some of the proof of Einstein’s theories had long been elusive, beyond the capabilities of technology, until now.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Interface
programme.desc: The Ionisphere, where the Earth interfaces with space, is little understood, it effects radio communications, GPS signals and satellites alike.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Borderland
programme.desc: Deserts and dunes, cliffs and canyons. Although Mars is certainly an alien wasteland, it is a planet with terrestrial formations remarkably similar to those found on Earth.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Cold War & The Start of the Space Race - Cold War rivalry and the acceleration of space exploration. Servicing Hubble - Preparations for Hubble's final servicing mission. Chasing a Comet - Launch and the difficult path to rendezvous.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Rocky Shores
programme.desc: The arid shores of other planets tell the stories of their past. What did they look like, and could they have ever supported life?

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini: Docking and EVA - In the final phase of the Gemini program NASA struggles with docking and spacewalks. Curiosity Roving Mars - On the surface of Mars the Curiosity rover is changing the way we think about the red planet.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Giant Planets: Lords of Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity is one of the most basic and powerful forces shaping our universe. Discover its nature within our own solar system, from the smallest moons to the largest planets.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Fresh Eyes
programme.desc: Two new space telescopes are in orbit and completing their shakedown; Gaia and TESS they too will be joined by the James Webb Telescope.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Living Planet
programme.desc: With continuous observation of arth from orbit scientists have built a data set over time that reveals much about how the Earth breaths and life sustains itself on this living Planet.

programme.title: STAR LIGHT, STAR BRIGHT
programme.desc: The two current science missions to our star; the sun have made great leaps forward in the science of how stars work, how they generate solar winds and how they affect their orbiting planets

programme.title: The New Frontier: Danger, Astreroids Ahead
programme.desc: The question often rises is the cost of space exploration really worth it? Could the money be better spent elsewhere.

programme.title: Spacetime: Silent companions - Moons in our planetary system
programme.desc: Since the beginning of time, the moon has been our loyal companion in the sky. But other planets also have satellites, more so than Earth. But what are moons really, how did they come about and do they actually even carry primitive life?

programme.title: Spacetime: Space Junk - Fast and dangerous
programme.desc: Every mission, every launch of a satellite means more objects in earth orbit. Countless parts are now orbiting our planet. But the waste means a growing danger - not only for manned spaceflight, but also for functioning satellites.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Set Course For Heart of the Sun
programme.desc: NASA’S Parker Solar Probe Mission is on its way and will be shortly followed by Europe’s Solar probe Mission.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Orbit
programme.desc: The International Space Station is undoubtedly the jewel in the crown of low Earth orbit; observation post, research lab and class room.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Getting There
programme.desc: Launching payloads into space is a very difficult task, historically rocket launches are the proverbial 'swords into ploughshares'.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Moons of Olympis
programme.desc: These are the the Moon's of the gas giants. Each a unique and mysterious world of its own. Some have oceans of water, geysers of Sulphur or atmospheres of plastic.

programme.title: The New Frontier: GIANTS IN THE DARK
programme.desc: Asteroids, the debris from the early solar system hold tantalizing clues to planetary formation. The spacecraft Psyche readies to study a unique metallic asteroid.

programme.title: The New Frontier: INCREASING ORBIT
programme.desc: The ISS is the workhorse of the international spacefaring community, but its days are numbered. R
